alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 4:50AM MST until January 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches below 7500ft. Generally 4 to 8 inches above 7500ft and amounts up to 12 inches over the peaks. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Mountains, Far Northwest Highlands, and Upper Rio Grande Valley. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Check road conditions before heading out. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow may reduce visibility to less than one mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley
